title: Trump Approves the Epstein Files Release, but Some May Be Withheld
summary: The president sought to take credit for the legislation, despite months of pressure to kill it. The bill has significant exceptions that could mean many documents would stay confidential.

title: Lawrence Summers Has Come Back From Scandals. Will This Be His Last?
summary: The former Harvard president has come back from controversy before, but revelations in new Epstein emails are threatening his omnipresence in public life.

title: Larry Summers to Stop Teaching at Harvard While It Investigates His Epstein Ties
summary: The former Harvard president had previously stepped down from other positions following revelations about his longtime connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Nvidia’s Eye-Popping Profit, and Where Those Scam Calls Are Coming From
summary: Plus, a surge in meat allergies caused by ticks.

title: Holiday Hiring Slows, Frustrating Job Seekers
summary: Retailers are adding fewer of the seasonal roles that many Americans rely on to make ends meet.

title: Walmart Sales Rise as Shoppers Look For Savings
summary: The retailer increased its guidance for the year, anticipating more price-conscious shoppers would flock to their stores.

title: Family Affair: Commerce Secretary’s Sons Cash In on A.I. Frenzy
summary: Howard Lutnick is helping push data center projects. His family companies are profiting from them.

title: Trump and Mamdani Will Meet at White House on Friday
summary: The meeting between Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, and President Trump will come after the two men have fiercely attacked one another.

title: Lindsey Halligan Admits Grand Jury Never Saw Final Comey Indictment
summary: Grand jurors have to vote on indictments to approve them, but a prosecutor told the judge in the case that only the foreperson formally approved the second charging document, a move that could cripple the case.

title: California Has a Legal Clause for Housing That Could Put NIMBYs in a Corner
summary: For years, the state has been nudging its cities to build housing to address a severe shortage. Maybe what they needed was a shove.

title: The Grand Ole Opry at 100
summary: As the country music institution celebrates a century of its radio broadcast, listen to how the show defined the culture — and was reshaped by it — decade by decade.

title: Move Over, Netflix: Ukraine’s Corruption Investigators Bring the Drama
summary: The country’s anti-graft agencies have taken a cinematic approach to revealing a scandal that has touched President Volodymyr Zelensky’s inner circle.

title: U.S.-Russian Peace Plan Would Force Ukraine to Cede Land and Cut Army
summary: The 28-point proposal, which comes as the Trump administration tries to restart settlement talks, includes demands long rejected by Kyiv as  nonstarters.

title: As Sanctions on Russian Oil Loom, India Prepares to End Its Buying Spree
summary: India has been snapping up discounted Russian crude for three years, but U.S. sanctions that take effect on Friday are expected to end the lucrative trade.

title: Nvidia Earnings Show Profit Jumped 65% to $31.9 Billion
summary: The company, which makes the computer chips essential to the artificial intelligence boom, also said revenue in its recent quarter rose to $57 billion.

title: Nvidia Earnings Fuel Rally in Global Technology Stocks
summary: The chipmaker’s profit surge and strong revenue forecast helped to ease fears that spending on A.I. infrastructure might be outpacing demand.

title: Trump Meeting With Saudi Prince Showcased Prince’s Makeover — and America’s
summary: Prince Mohammed was briefly a global pariah after the killing of a Saudi dissident. But over the years he has rebuilt his image as a deal-maker and influential investor.

title: Saudi Arabia’s Prince Has Big Plans, but His Giant Fund Is Low on Cash
summary: After nearly a decade of expensive, hit-and-miss investments, Mohammed bin Salman is overseeing a behind-the-scenes restructuring of the kingdom’s all-important wealth fund.

title: Cheney Service to Underscore How Politics Has Changed Since He Was in Office
summary: As the former vice president is honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes will focus on who comes — and who does not.

title: After a Mysterious Death, a Family’s Quest for Answers Leads to a Tick
summary: A JetBlue pilot’s illness looked like food poisoning, but it was actually an increasingly common tick-borne meat allergy that can be fatal.

title: Ambassador Huckabee Held Meeting With Jonathan Pollard, Ex-Spy, at U.S. Embassy in Israel
summary: Jonathan J. Pollard, who was convicted of espionage, said in an interview that the meeting, which was highly unusual for a U.S. diplomat to attend, had been friendly.

title: Franco Died 50 Years Ago, but He’s Still Winning New Fans in Spain
summary: Young Spaniards are increasingly drawn to the dictator Francisco Franco. So the government is designing apps, games and T-shirts to promote democracy.

title: As the World Pursues Clean Power, Millions Still Have No Power at All
summary: Just outside Belém, the Amazonian city where the world is meeting to discuss climate change, electricity is a very recent arrival.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Was Not on Our Bingo Card
summary: Have we been selling her short? Is she paving the way to the after-Trump?

title: Jimmy Kimmel Prepares for Hurricane Epstein
summary: Kimmel wondered if President Trump might “pull a Taylor Swift and give us ‘The Epstein Files: Donnie’s Version.’”

title: Mamdani and Tisch Agreed to Work Together. Here’s Where They Differ.
summary: The New York City mayor-to-be, Zohran Mamdani, and the head of the Police Department, Jessica Tisch, have gaps to bridge on crime and policing.

title: Top National Book Awards Go to Writing About the Middle East
summary: Rabih Alameddine’s “The True True Story of Raja the Gullible (and His Mother)” won in fiction, while Omar El Akkad’s reckoning with Gaza took the nonfiction prize.

title: Robert L. Stirm, Returning P.O.W. in Pulitzer-Winning Photo, Dies at 92
summary: The image immortalized a Vietnam veteran’s joyous homecoming to his beaming family, but it hid the truth about an unraveling marriage.

title: Florida Lawmaker Stole FEMA Funds for House Campaign, Prosecutors Say
summary: Representative Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick misused $5 million in Covid-related funds during the pandemic in part to finance her campaign, according to the Justice Department.
